Susan is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting additional new loan to sustain her food vending and selling of frozen food businesses.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Asip

texts.en:
Asip is 23 years old. He lives in the small village of Marneuli District with his parents and wife. Asip requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Asip serves local people as a taxi driver and gets income. Besides this, he has a plot of land where potatoes are grown. He does all the agricultural work with his parents to ensure a good harvest. They sell the harvested potatoes locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Asip requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Asip has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Asip will open a car wash. He will purchase all the needed equipment for washing cars. Asip is not experienced in this business but he will do his best to increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a car wash.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 35 years old. She lives in the small village of Khobi District with her husband, two children, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. Nino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milking cows and two calves whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides this, they have 300 nut trees and 1.25 hectares of agricultural land where maize is grown. They sell cheese with the harvested nuts and maize locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category.

Nino requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Nino will begin trade with clothing. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell at higher prices among her villagers. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with three children. She has received some schooling, till the end of junior high school. Currently, Rose sells porridge in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about six years now. Her husband is a mason. Rose’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Rose will use the loan to increase her existing porridge capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Rose plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing porridge capacity.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling onions and salt in Ab Nkwanta (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Adjoa is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in her family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Adjoa wants to use this loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of onions and salt. In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory of onions and salt

loans.name: Agnes D.'s Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the featured leader of this group of teachers from the northern city of Makeni. The 39-year-old is married to a school principal, and the couple has three children. Two of them are attending secondary school, and one is in college. Agnes has been a school teacher for many years. She has requested this loan in order to pay school and college fees for her children, and to renovate her house with the rest.
 
School staff and other salaried workers do normally come to SMT, Kiva’s first field partner in Sierra Leone, to apply for loans. As salaries are usually very small, these loans help borrowers to buy or invest in things that their salaries would not otherwise let them buy or invest in.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for her children, and to renovate her house

loans.name: Awareness Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Awareness” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Adenor is the featured leader of this group. Adenor is 48 years old and is married, with eight children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Adenor sells market food – tomatoes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for seven years now. 

With the help of this loan, Adenor will invest in her business by buying tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 10 years. Violeta earns more income from raising pigs.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has six children, aged 3, 6, 7, 13, 16 and 19. 

In 1998, Mohamed established his used shoes business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,859,500 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.

Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy an additional three bags of used sneakers. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand the business to a bigger shop and plans to open another outlet for his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for three bags of used sneakers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. Her children are between 31 and 22 years old and only one live at home in Montserrado County, which is noted as the commercial city in Liberia. Victoria is a high school graduate and her husband is a security guard. For five years now, she has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, and dresses. Most interestingly, she has many customers since she sells quality products. She started in business by selling roasted fish and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends six hours on her business. One of the problems she faces is transportation costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, T-shirts, and dresses) to increase her sales, She plans to open another shop in the near future and to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, T-shirts, and dresses) to sell

loans.name: Bowanah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Bowarah from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 4 and 8. One of her children is attending school.  

Bowarah runs a jewelry business; she sells local necklaces, bracelets, body cream, rings and hair cream. She started this business to improve her standard of living, and she has been running it for the past 15 years. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days a week. Bowarah says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Bowarah has requested a loan to purchase items like local necklaces, bracelets,body cream and hair cream  for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her child's school fees. 

In the future, she plans to further her education. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase items like local necklaces, bracelet,body cream, and hair cream  for resale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has owned a general store business in the Philippines for four years.

Wilma requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, eggs, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mitchelle works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Mitchelle is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items like canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles and soap to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting the additional loan to build up her general store and rice businesses.

Mitchelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like canned goods, spices, eggs, noodles and soap to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. Marilou has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income raising livestock.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married, with six children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell footwear and ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell footwear and ready-to-wear business for one year and also earns income from a general store and from farming vegetables.

Gina aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of footwear and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Manuel, quien con su crédito de Kiva compró sacos que comercializó al por mayor, en el centro de Barranquilla; sus ganancias aumentaron y también el crédito le alcanzó para invertir en la compra de un enfriador,  para aumentar la venta de bebidas y refrescos. Desde que recibió su credikiva ha apoyado  a su familia, pues le ha invertido a sus dos actividades y ellos están generando ingresos ayudándolo a él en ellas, por eso se siente muy contento. Manuel dice a sus financiadores de Kiva lo siguiente. “Muchísimas gracias por ese crédito y por la oportunidad de que mi negocio crezca. “ 
En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, con el comprará sacos sintéticos y de fique, los cuales tienen mucha demanda en su mercado y también invertirá en la compra de refrescos, tarea que genera ingresos y complementa sus ganancias  obtenidas por la venta de sacos, haciendo de su credikiva una efectiva inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Manuel, who used his last Kiva loan to buy sacks that he sold at wholesale in the center of Barranquilla. This increased his profits and the loan was also enough for him to buy a cooler in order to increase his sales of drinks and soft drinks. Since he received his Kiva loan he has been supporting his family, since he has involved them in his two activities and they are generating incomes by helping him out. He is very happy about this. Manuel tells his Kiva lenders the following: 'Thank you so much for this loan and for the opportunity to make my business grow'.

He is now applying for a new Kiva loan, which he will use to buy sacks made out of synthetic thread and of fique, both of which are in high demand at his market, and he will also invest in soft drinks, an activity that generates incomes and complements the profits made from selling sacks. He is efficiently investing his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks made out of synthetic fibre and of fique, and also to invest in soft drinks

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa es una señora muy emprendedora, madre de una niña, trabaja vendiendo ropa y otros artículos a domicilio, ya tiene su cartera de clientes pero desea aumentarla, para eso está solicitando un crédito por setecientos mil  colones exactos(¢700.000.ºº), con este dinero comprará ropa para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, Blanca Rosa nos manifiesta el agradecimiento por este tipo de apoyo financiero.
texts.en: Blanca Rosa is a very hardworking woman. Mother to a little girl, she works selling clothing door-to-door. She already has a customer base but she'd like to build on it, so she is asking for a loan of 700,000 colones with which she will buy clothing to meet her customers' orders. Blanca Rosa is very grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Jennifer has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from prepaid mobile load.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben has some goats and wants to build a stable with the amount of 160,000 ALL (Albanian Lek). For this, he is seeking lenders' attention. “I am poor and I know it and I am sad about it. My financial situation hasn't improved up to now, despite my attempts to work hard. I haven’t given up yet though, in hope that something would come up, and I consider the given opportunity of getting help from lenders as the light in the tunnel for me and my family,” Arben said looking away.
Arben is a 42-year-old father of a 3-year-old child and together with his family lives in a rural village of northern Albania. “While my wife takes care of our child, I take care of the rest, trying to secure our staple food at least; I see it impossible to bring an income home. Daily, I feed the goats and milk them, clean the place where they sleep at the moment because there is no stable yet for them, and make a little cheese."

loans.use: To build a stable for his goats

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 20 years old, single and works hard to support her parent.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy household foods such as canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar and noodles to sell for her general store business.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy household foods such as canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar and noodles to sell

loans.name: Felecita

texts.en:
Felecita is 49 years old and married, with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felecita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like candies, snack foods, shampoo, dishwashing powder, soap, canned goods, and sugar.

Felecita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and candies. In the future, Felecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like candies, snack foods, shampoo, dishwashing powder, soap, canned goods, and sugar.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell in her general store, like eggs, spices, noodles, soap, and milk.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell beauty products.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, spices, noodles, soap, and milk.

loans.name: Matlub

texts.ru: Матлуб жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 52 лет. Он женат и у него есть трое детей. Матлуб со своей семьёй живут в сельской местности. Два его сына уже взрослые и помогают своему отцу по хозяйству. Для того, чтобы иметь стабильный доход, Матлуб занимается животноводством, в этом деле ему также помогает жена. Она ухаживает за скотом в процессе откармливания и занимается продажей молока, полученного от этого скота. Матлуб не только сам занимается животноводством, он также является руководителем деканского хозяйства в своём посёлке.  От ведения своего бизнеса - животноводства Матлуб получает хорошую прибыль. Сейчас расходы семьи Матлуба увеличиваются, так как сыновья теперь имеют свои собственные семьи и детей, которых нужно обеспечивать. Поэтому Матлуб вместе со своими сыновьями хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь больше дохода, которого будет хватать для того, чтобы обеспечить своей большой семье достойное проживание. Поэтому Матлуб обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа нескольких голов скота для расширения имеющегося бизнеса. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Matlub is a cheerful man, age 52.  He is married and has three children.  He lives with his family in rural area.  Two of his sons are grown and help him with his work. To have a stable income, Matlub works with livestock.  His wife helps him and takes care of the cows while they are being fattened.  She also sells the dairy products provided by the cows' milk.  Matlub not only works with animals, he is also the head of a cooperative farm in his village.  He receives good profits from his business.  Now, the family's expenses are increasing since his sons have their own wives and children that need to be provided for.  Together with his sons, Matlub wants to expand his business to increase their income enough to provide for the large family.  He has turned to Arvand to take a loan to buy a few head of cattle.  He hopes for a positive outcome and is grateful for Arvand's support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hushruz

texts.ru: Хушруз добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 сына, которому 1 год. Хушрузу 21 года. Он более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Он занимается купле продажей продуктов питания в магазине, который находится в центральном базаре его села. Он старается обеспечить своих клиентов высококачественными товарами, так как он считает, что здоровое питание - это гарант здорового образа жизни. Он продает все не обходимые продукты питания как напитки, сахар, конфеты, печенье и т.п. Его жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Он хочет развевать бизнес дальше и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки товара для увелечения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на Ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hushruz is a conscientious and hardworking person.  He is married and has one son who is one year old.  Hushruz is 21 years old and has five years of experience running his own business.  He buys and sells food products at a store at a central bazaar in his village.  He tries to provide his clients with high-quality goods as he believes a healthy diet is the foundation of a healthy lifestyle.  He sells everything you need, such has drinks, sugar, candy, cookies, etc.  His wife helps him run the business and he now wants to expand further.  For this purpose, he is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy inventory to increase his working capital.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy food items to increase working capital

loans.name: Rahimkul

texts.ru: Рахимкул успешно окончил фармацевтику и много лет работал в государственной аптеке. Он имеет большого опыта в сфере фармацевтики. Данное время он имеет свою аптеку, где продаёт разнообразные лекарства. Его аптека находится в центре его села и поэтому он имеет много клиентов. Так как он имеет много клиентов, он хочет развевать бизнес дальше. Он является основным кормильцем в семье, так как его жена не имеет большого источника дохода. Он отец 3 детей. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки лекарств. Он не только зарабатывает деньги посредством своего бизнеса, но и выполняет социальную миссию, так как он на страже здоровья местных жителей. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rahimkul successfully finished pharmacy school and for many years he worked at a state pharmacy. He has long experience in the pharmaceutical area. Currently he has his own pharmacy, where he sells different types of medicine. His pharmacy is in the center of his village, and therefore he has many customers. As he has many customers, he would like to develop his business further.

Rahimkul is the only breadwinner in the family, as his wife does not have a large source of income. He is the father of three children. He requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar for the purchase of medicine. He does not only earn money from his business, he also performs a social mission, as he guards the health of the local residents. 

Rahimkul awaits your kindness and hoes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Judith Elena

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de 51 años, por la falta de recursos económicos sus padres le ayudaron a terminar solo la escuela primaria, desde muy joven ella ayudaba en los quehaceres del hogar y se casó siendo muy joven con quien ahora tiene su hogar; su esposo Nelson de 53 años quien es chofer profesional y se dedica a esta actividad. Esta pareja de esposos que ya no tiene hijos a su cargo viven en Latacunga un lugar que cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos para turistas nacionales y extranjeros principalmente por el Centro Histórico de la ciudad que ha sido considerado Patrimonio Cultural del Ecuador desde hace casi 30 años. Capital de una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador; Cotopaxi y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante a pesar de que las estadísticas indican un índice de pobreza que supera el 50%. Sin embargo las personas han buscado la forma de no estancarse y salir adelante, por lo que han puesto en marcha sus ideas y muchas de ellas de forma empírica. 
Desde hace 20 años, Judith tiene una tienda de abastos que atiende desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta pasado el atardecer, completando casi 10 horas o más cada día. En su tienda cuando tiene espacios libres, ella también hace labor de costura como un pasatiempo.  Judith desea surtir su tienda con nueva mercadería y productos actuales que le generen mejores ingresos y además atraigan más clientes a su tienda, su dificultad más grande ha sido la burocracia de las instituciones financieras, quienes han puesto varios obstáculos para otorgarle un préstamo que lo utilizaría en capitalizar su negocio con mercadería de productos de primera necesidad y golosinas; para hacer esto posible Judith solicita un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa en donde encontró la confianza, agilidad y apertura que siempre buscó y agradece a Kiva quienes hacen que muchas personas alrededor del mundo sean partícipes de sus sueños. Judith espera que los ingresos adicionales los pueda utilizar en apoyar a sus hijos que a veces atraviesan por necesidad económica y además reinvertir siempre en la adquisición de nueva mercadería y así hacer que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Judith is a 51-year-old woman. Due to a lack of economic resources, her parents were only able to support her through primary school. Since she was little she has contributed to the household chores, and she was very young when she married. Her husband Nelson, 53, works as a professional chauffeur. The couple do not have any children living at home. They live in Latacunga, a place which has a number of attractions for national and international tourists, including the city's historical centre, which has been considered part of Ecuador's cultural heritage for nearly 30 years and is capital of one of the provinces of Ecuador's Sierra region, and the Cotopaxi volcano. In recent years, the city has developed considerably and is now considered one of the most important in the region, thanks to the flower, mineral, metal, agriculture and farming industries. There are also several businesses generating significant revenue, helping to convert the city into a commercial centre with opportunities for people to get ahead. Despite a poverty rate of over 50%, people have looked for a way to move forward and to make their ideas a reality.

For 20 years, Judith has run a convenience store which is open from very early in the morning to the evening, for 10 hours or more every day. When she has free time in her shop, she makes extra money by sewing. Judith wants to stock up her shop with new products which will generate a better income and attract more customers. Her biggest difficulty has been bureaucracy; financial institutions have put various obstacles in the way of her getting the loan she wants to use to expand her business to sell first aid products and sweets. Therefore, Judith has asked for a loan from Fundación Alternativa, with whom she found the reliability, flexibility and openness she had been looking for. She is thankful to Kiva for enabling people around the world to be part of her dream. Judith hopes that she will be able to use the additional income to support her children, who at times struggle economically, and she would also like to reinvest in her business by buying new merchandise.

loans.use: to stock up her shop

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mhamoud is 25 years old from Gaza. He owns a shop raising and selling birds and has been in business since 2011.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy cages, water and food trays, and more birds for his shop.
He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income

loans.use: to buy cages, water and food trays, and more birds for his bird shop.

loans.name: Mel-Rose

texts.en:
Mel-Rose is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a retail gasoline business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Mel-Rose has been in this business for three years. She also earns income from a general store and charcoal business.

Mel-Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money for business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 30 years old and married with six children, four in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed.

Jovelyn has been pig fattening for one year and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional pig and feed

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Lina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell for her business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Margie has been in this business for four years. Margie earns more income from farming and selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to build her general store and farming and vegetable selling business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani is 40 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lailani is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional rice seed, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Lailani has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional rice seed, fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Sharofiddin

texts.ru: Шарофиддину 40 лет. Он с женой, сыном и дочерью проживает в городе Исфара. Его жена занимается шитьем занавесок и штор, а дети учатся. У Шарофиддина среднее техническое образование. Он более 16 лет занимается производством водосточных труб. Его деятельность приносит хороший доход, за счет которого он обеспечивает семью. Шарофиддин всегда старается выполнять свою работу качественно и в срок. Сейчас он запрашивает кредит закупа жести. С помощью кредита он хочет увеличить производство водосточных труб и продвигать дальше свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sharofiddin is 40 years old. He, his wife, son and daughter live in the city of Isfara. His wife works with sewing curtain and blinds, and his children study. Sharofiddin has secondary technical education. For more than 16 years he has worked with manufacturing drain pipes. His business brings in a good income, on the basis from which he supports his family. 

Sharofiddin always tries to perform his work with high quality an on time. Currently he requests a loan to purchase tin metal. With the help of the loan he would like to increase the production of drain pipes and move on with his business.

loans.use: to purchase tin metal for the manufacturing of drain pipes

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Mr Kalifa est né vers 1972 à Lobougoula. Père de 9 enfants il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants à Lobougoula un des commune de Sikasso 3ème      région administrative de la république du Mali.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs, il compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalifa was born around 1972 in Lobougoula. A father of nine children, he lives with  his wife and children in Lobougoula, a Commune in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out his farm work during the rainy season. He is on his fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn. He intends to purchase the farm inputs and to pay for the plowing for maintaining 2 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village, at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of men and women. He plans on making an average profit of 350,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him to meet his family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe LUMIÈRE sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelle à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieure ont été bien dénoué.
MARIAM  debout en quatrième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait la vente d’encens dans ce groupe de femmes LUMIÈRE, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  la matière première comme gueni, parfums et magnonkisèni pour fabriquer de l’encens. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne en matière première su r place et vend à Sikasso.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the group LUMIÈRE are essentially married women averaging 45 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The previous loans were indeed settled.

MARIAM, who is standing fourth from the left in the photo, sells incense in this group of women. She is famous for incense, thus she is a vendor in high demand. She intends to use her loan for raw materials, such as 'gueni', perfumes, and 'magnonkisèni' for making incense. Accepting cash or credit, she sells these products door to door and with her family to a customer base composed of men and women. She gets her supplies of raw materials locally and sells in Sikasso. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to repay the loan with interest, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making incense

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   Tiessiri sont des Hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’Tessoni, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
lls sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr Brehima debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter les semences  les engrais  pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 500 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Tiessiri are men averaging 45 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in N’Tessoni, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Mr. Brehima, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With his loan, he intends to purchase seeds and fertilizer for maintaining 3 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of men and women. He plans on making a profit of 500,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him to repay the loan with interest and also to meet his family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун умный и трудолюбивый человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. После успешного окончания средней школы он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Он данное время является студентом 1 курса и учится отлично и хорошо. Все его однокурсники уважают его за его честность и доброту. Он читает много книг в свободное время и смотрит интеллектуальные телепередачи. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но его родители не имеют денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Faridun is an intelligent and hardworking man. He is 18 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. 

After successfully finishing secondary school, he entered the Tajik University of Commerce. Currently he is a first year student and he studies hard. All his classmates respect him for his honesty and kindness. He reads many books in his spare time and watches intellectual TV programs. 

Faridun needs to pay his tuition, but his parents do not have money for it. He requests a loan in the amount of 800 US dollar to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Idalia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Idalia  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  en una comunidad en el  sur de Honduras.
Doña Idalia su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 2 años, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, refrescos etc. 
Doña Idalia con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor a sus clientes. 
Doña Idalia  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia, en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona, y  seguir  apoyando que sus   hijos   para que  sean personas  de bien para la  sociedad. 	



Choluteca,  Honduras  –  Mayo   del   2013
texts.en:
Señora Idalia is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person.  She lives with her husband and three children in a community in southern Honduras.  Doña Idalia's business is a grocery store, and has been for more than two years.  She needs the loan to buy lard, rice, beans, meat, sodas, etc.  She hopes that with the loan, sales at her business will increase once she has more product to offer and to better care for her customers.  

She hopes to cover her needs and to slightly improve her quality of life and that of her family.  She hopes that in several years the business continues to grow and it becomes one of the largest and most recognized in the area, and that it continues to support her children so that they can become good people in society.

Choluteca, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: to buy lard, rice, beans, meat, sodas, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 39-year-old man from Gaza. He is married and has six kids, five of whom attend primary school. He has owned a grocery store since 2010. Khaled asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and install shelves to display more goods in his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his sales and thus improve his income to allow him to provide his children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install shelves to display more goods in his grocery store.

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNION PROGRESO” está conformada por 11 mujeres emprendedoras quienes se dedican a las diversas aéreas del comercio minoristas. Carole cumple la función de secretaria en el grupo tiene 32 años es conviviente con un hijo dependiente. En el año 2006 implemento su negocio de ropa, bebidas y golosinas en su vivienda a la actualidad viene realizando dicha actividad. Años atrás era estudiante universitario y en sus tiempos libres trabajaba como nana. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, frazadas y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio y terminar de hacer la fachada de su casa. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Carole es la primera persona parada del lado derecho. La Sra. Lucy no pudo estar presente para la foto por encontrarse en su centro de labores.
texts.en:
The group "Union Progreso" is made up of 11 women entrepreneurs who work in diverse areas of retail.  Carole, who serves as the secretary of the group, is 32 years old and is in a civil union with a dependent son.  In 2006, she started her home business where she sells clothes, beverages and snacks, which she continues to run now.  Before that, she was a university student and in her free time worked as a nanny.  

She will invest the loan in new clothes, blankets, and beverages.  Her biggest wish is to expand her business and finish building the facade of her house.  The group thanks the investors from KIVA for the loans.  Carole is the first person standing at the right.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, blankets, and beverages.

loans.name: Siempre 10 Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este es el  grupo Siempre 10 al Progreso

La Sra. Georgina tiene 60 años, es casada vive con sus 02 hijas cada una con su propia familia. La Sra. Georgina empezó su negocio hace muchos años, gracias al apoyo de su esposo y su familia, ella vende productos de belleza y bijouteria, también confecciona joyas artesanales como collares, pulseras y aretes, tiene como sus mayores clientes a sus vecinas y amigas que son sus asiduas compradoras. Georgina quiere seguir trabajando por eso seguirá  invirtiendo el dinero de su préstamo en la compra de materiales para confeccionar mas joyas y otra parte para comprar productos de belleza, su trabajo la hace sentirse orgullosa porque gracias a ello siempre ha podido ayudar a su esposo en la manutención del hogar. Georgina se siente feliz de lograr un nuevo préstamo y quiere agradecer el apoyo a los inversionistas de KIVA que ayudan a personas como ella y su grupo comunal.
En la foto viste casaca color fucsia. La Sra. María no pudo estar presente por que en ese momento se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
This is the Siempre 10 al Progreso group. Georgina is 60 years old and is married and lives with her two daughters who both have their own families. She began her business many years ago thanks to the support of her husband and family. She sells beauty products and jewelry. She makes artisan jewelry including necklaces, bracelets and earrings. The majority of her clients are her neighbors and friends who are her constant clients.

Georgina wants to continue working and it is for this reason that she will continue investing her loan in the purchase of materials to make more jewelry and also to buy beauty products. Her work makes her feel proud because thanks to this she has always been able to help her husband with the household maintenance. Georgina is happy to receive a new loan and wants to thank the Kiva investors for their support for helping people like her and her group. 

In the photo she is dressed in a fuschia sweater. Another member, Maria, is shown in the attached photo.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and materials.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
El Señor Mariano es una persona emprendedora, honesta y seria, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de  pan. 
Don Mariano el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de cemitas, polvorones, pan blanco, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Don Mariano sus clientes son amigos y vecinos de su comunidad los cuales visitita a diario en su bicicleta para ofrecerle sus productos.
Don  Mariano espera que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia e hijos y que estos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  con principios y valores.



Choluteca, Honduras –   Mayo  del   2013
texts.en:
Mariano’s an enterprising, honest, serious person living with his wife and two children in south Honduras.  His business is selling bread.  He needs the loan to buy rolls, cookies, white bread, etc.  He hopes the loan will help his sales to increase by having more product on-hand to offer to his customers.  Mariano’s customers are his friends and neighbors in his community who he visits daily on his bicycle to offer his products.  

Mariano hopes that in about three years his business will continue growing and consolidating so that it will become the largest and best known in the zone and he can continue supporting his family and children and that they complete their studies and become honest people with principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy cookies, bread, etc.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio, de 34 años de edad, es originario de la comarca Tomatoyita en las afueras de Boaco, casado, padre de 1 hijo de 3 años de edad. El se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles y trigo desde hace 19 años. Actividad que aprendió por tradición pues sus padres se dedicaron a las labores del campo y el fue criado entre siembras y ordeño de vacas pues la mayoría de las personas les enseñan a sus hijos a sembrar desde muy pequeños para poder sobrevivir. A los 15 años ya sabía hacer huertas. Al casarse se independizo de sus padres y actualmente tiene su casita y sus vacas, él  trabaja junto con su esposa para sacar delante de su familia. Sus labores empiezan desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada  y finaliza  hasta que el sol se oculta. Su esposa lo ayuda a hacer cuajadas y preparar la leche para salir a vender y de esta manera conseguir otras formas de ingresos. 
Hoy está requiriendo el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar maíz y frijol, pues espera sacar una producción con buen rendimiento y calidad.  Uno de sus planes una vez cancelado el crédito es mejorar la crianza de ganado para aumentar la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Eleuterio, 34, is from Tomatoyita District in the outskirts of Boaco.  He’s married and father of a 3-year-old son.  He has worked growing corn, beans and wheat for the last 19 years, an activity he learned as a family tradition since his parents worked in the fields and he was raised among the crops and milking cows since most people teach their children to plant when they are still very little in order to survive.  At the age of 15 he already knew how to plant fields.  

When he married he became independent from his parents and now has his own house and cows.  He works alongside his wife in order to move the family forward.  His chores start very early in the dawn hours and end after sunset.  His wife helps him make cheese and to get the milk ready to be sold and they earn extra money this way.

Today, he’s asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs to plant corn and beans because he’s hoping for a good crop yield of quality products.  One of his plans once he’s repaid the loan is to improve the cattle-raising in order to increase milk production.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Bohirjon

texts.ru:
Бохирчон вместе со своей семьей живет далеко от города, в селе. Он как другие местные  жители занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур уже более 10 лет. Он опытный фермер. Вместе со своими родственниками он создал частное фермерское хозяйство и упорно трудится каждый день для того, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Он имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. В основном он откармливает корову. 
Несмотря на свою молодость, он уже ведет свое дело серьёзно и успешно. Ему 24 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 не совершеннолетнего ребенка. Его родители живут вместе с ним. Его отец и жена помогают ему введению бизнеса. Он должен купить минеральные удобрения и оплатить наемным работникам, а также купить корову для увеличения количества скота, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bohirjon and his family live far away from the city, in a village. Like the other local residents, he has worked with growing agricultural crops for more than 10 years. He is an experienced farmer. Together with his relatives, he established a private farm and works persistently every day in order to earn money for living. He also has an additional income from livestock breeding. He mainly fattens cattle. 

Despite his youth, Bohirjon already runs his business seriously and successfully. He is 24 years old. He is married and raising a young child. His parents live together with them. His father and wife help him in managing the business. 

Bohirjon needs to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay his hired workers, and also to purchase a cow to increase the number of cattle, but he does not have the money for it. He requests a loan in the amount of 7,000 somoni. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, a cow and to pay hired workers

loans.name: Fariq 22 Group

texts.en: Fariq 22 is a group of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a loan in the amount of 105,000 YER to buy home appliances. Rasha, 32 years-old, is the leader of the group. She is a married woman. She lives with her family in a small house in Taiz. She is working very hard to cover the needs of her family, but her income is not enough to pay for everything. She decided to buy home appliances, so she applied for a 15,000 YER loan to buy home appliances for personal use. She hopes that she will be able to buy all the home appliances she needs.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for personal use.

loans.name: Al-Mswry Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Mswry and is made up of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen, and have taken a loan of 80,000 YER. Abeer is a 23-year-old woman. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of money, so she is requesting a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to purchase home appliances for her house. She is the leader of the group, and she hopes to offer her family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for their houses.

loans.name: Dennis Nahum

texts.es:
El señor Dennis, de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, valle en la zona sur de Honduras.
Don Dennis se dedica desde hace 10 años a la reparación de carros como ser revisión de válvulas, cambio de bovinas, engrase general, cambio de mangueras de motor y todo lo relacionado a las reparaciones de carro.
Don Dennis realiza su trabajo de lunes a domingo en donde le visitan todos sus vecinos y amigos que le prefieren por su amabilidad y buen trato
Don Dennis está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de  más repuestos para carros como mangueras de motor, aceites, bovinas, válvulas, etc., porque su clientela a aumentado y necesita tener más variedad de repuestos.
Don Dennis su sueño es ponerle un negocio a su esposa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Dennis is 34 years old and lives with his wife in their house in the town of San Lorenzo, Valle, in the southern part of Honduras.

Dennis has worked for 10 years repairing cars - things like inspecting valves, changing coils, general oiling, changing motor hoses and everything related to car repairs. Dennis works from Monday to Friday where all his friends and neighbours that prefer him for his kindness and good treatment come to see him. 

Dennis is applying for the loan to buy more spare parts for cars like motor hoses, oils, coils, valves, e.t.c. because his customer base has grown and he needs a bigger range of spare parts. 

Dennis' dream is to establish a business for his wife. San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy motor hoses, oils, coils, valves, e.t.c. for his business.

loans.name: Santos Reniery

texts.es:
El Señor Santos es una persona emprendedora, honesta y seria, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. 
Don Santos su negocio es la venta  de  pan  dese hace mas  de 15  años. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de polvorones, cemitas, pan blanco, rosquillas, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercadería para vender.
Don Santos sus clientes todas la personas que lo visitan y también los turistas que llegan a esta zona que es muy visitada y gracias a esto espera que su situación económica y la de su familia mejore un poco.
Don  Santos  espera que  en unos 2 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia. y 



Choluteca, Honduras –  Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
Santos is an enterprising, honest and responsible person. He lives with his wife and their 4 children in south Honduras. 

Santos has had a business selling bread for more than 15 years. The loan he needs is to buy polvorones (a kind of thick cookie), white bread rolls, white bread, doughnuts, e.t.c. With the loan he hopes that his business sales will increase on having more products to sell. Santos' customers are all the people that visit him and also the tourists that come to the area, which is very popular, and thanks to that he hopes his financial situation and that of his family will improve a bit. 

Santos hopes that in 2 years or so his business will keep growing and getting stronger so it becomes the biggest and most well-known in the area and keeps supporting his family. 

Choluteca, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy polvorones (a kind of thick cookie), white bread rolls, white bread, doughnuts, e.t.c. for his business

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 33 years old, from Tulkrem. He is married and has two children.

Rani has owned a cattle farm since 2011 and has one employee. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy more cattle and more food for the cattle farm he owns. 

Through this loan, Rani will be able to increase the productivity of the farm and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and more food for the cattle farm he owns.

loans.name: Francisca Marleny

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer de 41 años de edad soltera y con 4 años de educación primaria cursados. Ella es madre de familia pero sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes en hogares aparte y ayudan a su madre con algunas actividades en el campo. Ella aprendió la agricultura gracias a sus padres ya que ellos se dedican a la agricultura hace muchos años y esta actividad viene de generación en generación en su familia. Sus clientes son las personas de otras comunidades como también los vecinos entre otros.

Ella ha solicitado a la Cooperativa COMIXMUL un apoyo económico para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que es necesario para evitar la contaminación de plagas y enfermedades como la roya mediante la compra de abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas.    

Ella planea a corto plazo comprar un poco más de tierra para poder seguir cultivando y así mejorar sus cultivos y sus ingresos ya que sus planes a futuro son los de mejorar su casa seguir re-invirtiendo en sus cultivos hasta que DIOS le de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 41 year old woman. She is single. She completed 4 years of primary education. She is a mother but her children are grown up and independent, living in their own homes. They help their mother with some activities in the fields. She learned farming from her parents, as they have worked in agriculture for many years. This activity has been passed down from generation to generation in her family. Her customers include people from other towns, as well as from her local area, and others.

She has requested economic support from the Comixmul Cooperative for the upkeep and maintenance of her coffee crops. This is necessary in order to avoid infestation by insects and also diseases, for example, blight. To do this, she will buy manure, fertilisers and insecticides. 

In the short term, she plans to buy some more land in order to continue growing and improving her crops and her income. Her future plans include making improvements to her home and to re-invest in her crops as long as God allows.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of her coffee crops

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, a secondary school graduate, is a 25-year-old, single man. He lives with his parents in a small house in Ibb governorate, Yemen. 

Five years ago, Mohammed's father sold a small piece of land to buy a minibus for his son. This minibus is the only income source for Mohammed. The minibus now needs some maintenance and Mohammed does not have enough money, so he applied for a loan in the amount of YER 100,000. 

Mohammed looks forward to get married soon.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing spare parts for his minibus.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David,  vive en la comarca Las Canoas en las afuera de Boaco, de oficio comerciante, casado, padre  de 3 hijos de 17,13 y 10 años de edad de los cuales solo dos están estudiando. Él se dedica a la venta de CD, su hijo mayor trabaja junto con el vendiendo. El inicio este negocio hace 10 años cuando todavía se usaban cassette, vendía de forma ambulante de casa en casa, participaba en ferias y eventos del pueblo siempre buscando como vender su mercadería. Pero con sus ahorros y un préstamo logro conseguir su propio local, su expectativa es aumentar un poco más su inventario. Es por eso que está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar CD y DVD películas pues siempre se necesita ofrecer variedad para complacer el gusto de sus clientes, él dice que la música que más le compran son las rancheras y  la música de Banda corridos. 
Su meta es lograr que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro que el tratando de asegurarle sus estudios pues es la única herencia que les puede dejar y mantener el negocio estable, prospero pues es la actividad con la que sobrevive su familia.
texts.en:
David lives in the Las Canoas district in the outskirts of Boaco.  He’s a merchant by profession, married and father of three children aged 17, 13 and 10; only two of them are still in school.  

He sells CDs and his oldest son works with him selling.  He started the business ten years ago when cassettes were still used; he’d sell them from place to place going house to house.  He participated in street markets and events in town always looking for ways to sell his merchandise.  

However, he used his savings and a loan to get his own locale and his hope is to increase his inventory a bit which is why he needs financing to buy CDs and movie DVDs because he always needs to offer variety to meet his customers’ various tastes.  He says that music, especially rancheras and corridos, are what he sells the most.  

His goal is that his children have a better future than he; he’s trying to insure their schooling because that’s the only inheritance he can leave them and to keep his business stable and prosperous because it’s the activity his family survives with.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor es a propietaria de una miscelánea donde vende mercancía variada, y ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, actividad que inició desde hace 4 años, cuando observando la oportunidad en sus alrededores pues existía una demanda de productos de tocador, artículos de bisutería, cosméticos decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios ofreciendo estos productos. Inicialmente lo hizo con poca mercancía, pero en la medida en que creció su mercado empezó a aumentar  su inventario y así mismo su oferta de servicios, hoy vende de todo un poco, útiles escolares, papelería, cosméticos, detalles para el hogar, bolsos y adicionalmente ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje en un punto comercial ubicado en su propia casa, donde sus clientes se acercan a comprar los productos o servicios, de lunes a domingos y desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta compartida con su esposo y más adelante,  es tener su propia casa, porque en la actualidad  vive arrendada. Flor  Está aplicando a su primer credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará articulos de papelería, accesorios femeninos, bolsos, cosméticos y detalles para el hogar, con e fin de tener nuevos inventarios de los productos de mayor rotación en su negocio y generar mayores utilidades que de costumbre, para hacer de credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Flor owns a variety store where she sells assorted goods and offers photocopying services, an activity she started four years ago noting the opportunity that existed in her zone because demand for beauty products, costume jewelry and cosmetics was high.  She decided to start her own business venture offering these products.  

At first, she started out with little merchandise but as her market grew she started to increase inventory and the services she offered.  Today, she sells a little of everything: school supplies, stationery supplies, cosmetics, home décor items, purses and also offers photocopying services in a commercial point located at home.  Her customers come by to buy products or services from Monday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.  The future goal she and her husband share is to own a house because they currently rent.

Flor’s applying for her first Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy stationery supplies, women’s accessories, purses, cosmetics and home décor items in order to have new inventory and more turn-around in her business to generate higher profits than usual so her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: toi buy paper goods, women's accessories, purses, cosmetics and home decor items.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Vicenta con su creikiva, mediante el cual compró materias prima e inumos con os cuales elaboró productos alimenticios como arepas, empanadas y papas rellenas. Con esta inversión su producción se incrementó,produjo mas ganancias y con ella hizo adecuaciones a su vivienda. Su negocio está mas surtido, vende mas y en su vida está mucho mas  tranquila. Ella está muy contenta y dice a los finaciadores de Kiva: "Gracias por apoyarme en mi negocio, tengo muchos años de estar en esta actividad y no me habia ido tan bien como ahora". En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva para comprar un enfriador, utensilios de cocina y un nuevo freidor. Con esta inversión su camino hacia el éxito se va vislumbrando cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Vicenta with her Kiva loan that she used to buy raw materials and supplies to make food items like arepas [Colombian grilled corn cakes], turnovers and stuffed potatoes.  With this investment her production increased, she produced more profits that she used to make home improvements.  Her business is better stocked, she sells more and her life is much more tranquil.

She’s very happy and says to her Kiva lenders: “Thanks for supporting me in my business; I’ve been in this business for many years and I’d never done as well as I’m doing now.”  At present, she’s applying for a new Kiva loan to buy a cooler, kitchen utensils and a new fryer.  With this investment her road to success is becoming clearer each time.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, kitchen utensils and a new fryer.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 37-year-old woman from Gaza. She is married and has seven children. She asked Ryada for this start-up loan in order to start her own embroidery business and buy a sewing machine and an electricity generator.

Manal has five years of embroidery experience. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family's income to approach her dreams of having their own house and providing her children with the best education.

Ryada's start-up loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to start her own embroidery business and buy a sewing machine and an electricity generator.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 56 años, creció en un hogar del campo en donde recibió el apoyo para culminar la escuela primaria, luego le impartieron el empírico conocimiento del trabajo con todo lo relacionado con la agricultura. Actualmente está casado con María quien tiene 43 años y trabaja como ama de casa y también ayudando a Julio en las labores del campo. Viven solos en el Cantón de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. Los productos agrícolas más comercializados son granos como arveja, fréjol, lenteja, haba y también varias frutas y verduras. La producción de leche y sus derivados abastece la distribución interna y el excedente se envía a la Región Costa en productos ya procesados. La crianza de animales es también muy favorable por el  clima agradable del que se goza en el Cantón. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
Julio aprendió las labores del campo desde que era un niño y luego las convirtió en su trabajo habitual para poder llevar siempre el sustento a casa. Ya lleva 30 años en la labor de sembrar, cosechar y comercializar papas y chochos, además de criar ganado para la producción de leche o para la posterior venta de los animales. Su esposa es de gran ayuda en esta actividad, pues las ocasiones que Julio sale a vender, ella alimenta a los animales o prepara la tierra en donde están los cultivos. Julio invierte al menos 6 horas a su negocio y cada vez tiene la expectativa de verlo crecer, sin embargo la dificultad de obtener créditos para capitalizar el negocio, ha sido muy grande y no ha podido acceder a los créditos de financieras comunes. Gracias al apoyo, credibilidad, agilidad y confianza que le brindaron en Fundación Alternativa, Julio ha decidido solicitar un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de ganado para la producción de leche y además la posterior venta de los animales. Julio está entusiasmado porque al fin tendrá la oportunidad de ver crecer a su negocio y con esto generar mayor utilidades que le permitan brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su esposa y a él y además les permita tener un ahorro para solventar gastos futuros de salud y falta de trabajo que puedan presentarse con la edad avanzada. Julio agradece a todos quienes a través de la gestión de Kiva puedan ser parte de este crecimiento en su vida y les motiva a seguir apoyando los emprendimientos y microempresas de las personas que como él sueñan con tener calidad de vida en sus hogares.
texts.en:
Julio is a man of 56. He grew up in a country household where he received the support to complete his primary school. Later, they imparted to him the practical knowledge of work in everything related to agriculture. Currently he is married to Maria, who is 43 and works as a housewife and also helps Julio with the farmwork. They live alone in Salcedo canton, located in the eastern part of Cotopaxi, one of the most important provinces in the Ecuadorian highlands. 

In Salcedo there are various tourist attractions such as lakes and beach resorts which offer extreme sports for adventurous tourists. However the main activity that is carried on in this town is agriculture, and it to a lesser extent cattle raising. The most important agricultural products are staples such as  peas, beans, lentils, lima beans and also various fruits and vegetables. The production of milk and its byproducts supplies internal distribution and the excess is sent to the coastal region as processed products. Cattle raising is also well-suited to this area because of the pleasant climate which is enjoyed in the canton. 

In spite of these productive activities, there are very worrisome indices of illiteracy and poverty, due unsatisfied basic needs such as sewage systems, which only 25% of the households have. 

Julio learned farmwork from the time he was a child and later made it his everyday work so as to always be able to support his household. He has been 30 years sowing, harvesting and selling potatoes and chochos (a food legume)  besides raising cattle for milk production. His wife is a great help in this activity as on the occasions when Julio goes out to sell, she feeds the animals or prepares the land where the crops are. 

Julio spends at least six hours in his business and each time has the hope of seeing it grow. However the difficulty of obtaining credit for capitalizing the business has been very great and he has not been able to access loans from regular banks. 

Thanks to the support, credibility, expeditious service and trust they offer at Fundación Alternativa, Julio has decided to request a loan which he will invest in the purchase of cattle for producing milk and for subsequent sale. Julio is enthusiastic because he will have the opportunity to see his business grow and with this generate greater profits which will allow him to offer him and his wife a better standard of living. In addition, it will allow them to have savings for meeting future health expenses and lack of work, both of which needs can arise with advanced age. 

Julio is grateful to those who through Kiva can be part of this growth in his life, and encourages them to continue supporting the business ventures of people, who like him, dream of having a better quality of life in their households.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase his production.

loans.name: Colonia Zapata Group

texts.es: El Grupo "Colonia Zapata" esta ubicado en una comunidad muy bonita, caracterizada por la siembra de su maíz pero sobre todo porque los vecinos de la misma comunidad son muy amables siempre. El grupo lo conforman seis mujeres muy trabajadoras siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Doña Andrea, uno de los miembros, comentó "Fue nuestra opción porque en esta misma comunidad hay otro grupo que tiene un nombre muy parecido" Doña Andrea tiene 42 años de edad está casada con el señor Germán quien trabaja como albañil, juntos han formado una familia con cuatro niños que aun dependen de ellos. Tres niños aún se encuentran estudiando. Doña Andrea se dedica a la engorda y venta de borregos desde hace 10 años. Esta vez esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas borregos y pastura, los compra medianos solo para engordarlos por un tiempo para después venderlos, comenta como inicio su actividad. Desde pequeña, Andrea que perdió a su madre, ayudaba a cuidar los borregos de su padre porque mientras él trabaja también se dedicaba a la cría de borregos para su venta y así obtener un ingreso mas para solventar los gastos de sus hermanos más pequeños. "Cuando me case  yo también quería ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mis hijos y gracias al crédito he podido hacer crecer el numero de mis borregos. La cria de los borregos es muy buena porque muchas veces cuando no tenemos dinero podemos vender nuestros borreguitos y así salir del apuro económico". Durante los diez años la única dificultad de Doña Andrea es cuando sus animalitos enferman y llegan a morir para Doña Andrea son perdidas de ganancias e inversión, aunque trata de cuidarlos mucho cada dos o tres meses su veterinario los revisa, Doña Andrea trabaja mucho en la cría de sus borregos para darle educación a sus hijos su sueño es que uno de sus hijos tenga alguna carrera profesional. Las integrantes del grupo al igual que Doña Andrea están muy contentas y agradecidas con KIVA y Vision Fund porque podrán invertir en sus negocios como Doña Leonarda, Aurelia, Maxima invertirá en Borregos, Martha invertirá en Pastura para sus animalitos, Ofelia invertirá pastura para sus becerros que tiene en casa.
texts.en: The "Colonia Zapata" group is from a very beautiful community known for its cornfields but above all for the unfailing kindness of its people. The group consists of six very hard-working women who place the welfare of their families above all else. One of the members, Doña Andrea, noted, "It was our choice because there is another group in the community with a very similar name."  She is 42 and married to Germán, a construction worker. They have four children who are all still dependents, three of whom are in school. For ten years, Doña Andrea has raised sheep and sold them. She buys the sheep young for the sole purpose of fattening and selling them. She is requesting this loan to purchase more sheep and feed. Doña Andrea began to help care for her father's sheep when she was a young girl and her mother died. She helped her father increase the family's income to meet the expenses of her raising her younger siblings. "When I got married, I also wanted to help my husband with the cost of raising our children. A loan helped me raise more sheep. Raising sheep is very good because many times we can sell them when we don't have money, which gets us through tough times. The only problem Doña Andrea has had in the past ten years has been when her sheep become sick and die. Sheep deaths represent losses of both income and investments to Doña Andrea. She therefore tries to take excellent care of them and has a veterinarian examine them every two to three months. Doña Andrea works long hours caring for her sheep so she can provide her children an education. Her dream is for one of the children to have a professional career. The other members of the "Colonia Zapata" group are very happy and grateful to KIVA and Vision Fund because they'll be able to invest in their businesses. Doña Leonarda, Aurelia, and Maxima will purchase sheep, Martha will purchase feed for her animals, and Ofelia will buy feed for the calves she keeps at her home.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and feed.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: “SANTA CRUZ DE COCACHACRA” es un grupo puntual en sus cuotas grupales. Está  conformada por 09 socios  quienes día a día trabajan para mejorar su economía familiar. Violeta tiene 51 años es casada con 1 hijo educando en la universidad. Hace varios implementó una bodega en su vivienda. En la actualidad  lo convirtió en restaurante  en donde ofrece golosinas, gaseosas. Años atrás trabajaba como ayudante de cocina. Es de esta manera que decidió emprender su negocio propio en el que le va bien. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y sillas y mesas para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es lograr que su hija termine su carrera profesional. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Violeta es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
