His only limitation is that he doesn't have enough money to keep growing, and he depends on this activity to get ahead. 

For that reason he has asked for his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from another institution, but FUDECOSUR gave him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz  tiene  52  años de edad, esta casada. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  unos cerdos y su posterior concentrado para su alimentación. Ella piensa darle una adecuada alimentación a estos animales y así con su proyecto de cerdos  poder generar más ganancias, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Luz, 52, is married. She plans to use this credit to buy some pigs and some concentrated feed for them. She wants to feed the animals well and use this project with her pigs to generate more income. She doesn't have the capital needed to make the purchase since she is low income and doesn't have the needed cash. For that reason she has asked for a loan from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had a loan from a state bank before, but FUDECOSUR gave her a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo  tiene  60  años de edad, esta casado y vive con la esposa y una hija actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Gerardo, 60, is married and lives with his wife and one daughter. With this loan he plans to buy inputs like compost, fumigants, and also labor to help him. He hopes to maintain his plantations so that they don't suffer any damage and he doesn't lose any of his production, which will let him generate more income from his coffee farm to contribute to his family. He doesn't have enough capital to buy the aforementioned products since he is low income and doesn't have any way to get the money. For that reason he asked for his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs for growing coffee.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of garlic, pepper, laurel, and candies for resale. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy products like garlic, pepper, laurel, and candies for resale. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma hopes that her business will be more profitable and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like garlic, pepper, laurel, and candies for resale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with two children and lives in Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing motor transportation services in the local community. She has been in this business for three years. She joined GDMPC microcredit in the year 2006, and she gained access to its microfinance services. 

Recently, she requested an amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase tires and to acquire licenses. She plans to buy another unit of motorcycle in order to expand the services, and she could generate additional income to support the needs of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and to acquire licenses.

loans.name: Ryan Joseph

texts.en:
Ryan Joseph, a 24-year-old married man with an only son, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He provides motor-transport services in the local community during his free time from work. It helps them to gather additional income for the daily basic needs of the family. 

In order to purchase motor accessories and repair the existing vehicle, he borrowed an amount of 15,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC microcredit. He hopes to gain more income from the business in order to support the needs of his only son.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories and repair the existing vehicle.

loans.name: Melton

texts.en:
Melton is 30 years old and single. He lives in a rural community with his beloved parents. Due to the hardships of life, he was not able to pursue his college education studies, for they could not afford to finance his schooling. Despite this, he has the ambition to become successful and financially stable in the future. 

To achieve his goals, he engaged himself in the hog-raising business to generate income. He planned to raise more pigs, but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 15,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy the needed feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.  Through his patience and strong determination, he believes that he will be able to improve the business and is hoping that someday, he will achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Veverly

texts.en:
This is Veverly, 41, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, who works as a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Veverly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500  PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Veverly dreams to expand her variety store into a grocery store and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 55, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlito, her business partner, and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates a welding shop. Her husband handles the labor work, like welding and the maintenance and repairing of some vehicles. She handles the finances, inventories and promotion of their business. They offer welding jobs, and repair and check-up of some types of vehicles. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in service fees every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edna dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 53 years old, is married with four children. Elizabeth has been engaged in hog raising for five years. She is a very diligent person; she makes sure that she can support the needs of her family. 

She is asking for a loan amounting to 15,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy feeds and additional piglets for her business. She hopes that her dreams come true for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa. She previously accessed a 10,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Right now, she is into a direct-selling business, where she in now more focused. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elsa dreams to be more successful and profitable in her business. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa. She previously accessed a 13,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more quantities of peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts and other kinds of peanuts to repack. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts and other kinds of peanuts to repack. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosa dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for peanuts, sweet beans, chestnuts and other kinds of peanuts to repack.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a hog raiser and also grows corn in their village. He has run his hog-raising business for 10 years, and has 12 years of experience in his corn-farming business. Joel is happily married and blessed with five children; three of them are already studying. 

Joel aspires to become a successful entrepreneur someday. This is the reason why he is doing his very best to attain his goal. To fulfill this, he would like to borrow a loan of 25,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) that he will use to purchase the necessary supply of feeds and vitamins for his hogs. He knows that by providing his hogs with proper care and nutrition, he could further sell his hogs at a greater price. He hopes that the lenders will grant his loan request for him to get ahead of life and be able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 51 years old, and married with five children. She is a very hardworking mother, and makes sure she can give all the needs of her family, most especially the needs of her children in school. 

Olivia has been engaged in a furniture business for ten years. She is asking for a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to buy wood, a planer and wood glue for her business.

loans.use: to buy wood, a planer and wood glue for her business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida. She previously accessed a 12,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Aida dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles et nucléaires à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieure ont été bien dénoué.
AOUA  debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait la vente d’habits à travers ce groupe de femmes SABOUGNOUMA.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  des 20 pièces de pagnes. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et revend à Sikasso.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 24.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabougnouma group are married women, who, on average, are 36 years old and have four children. They live in traditional and nuclear families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular areas of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their tenth loan with the mirco-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which allows them to meet their customers' needs. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Aoua, standing second from the left in the photo, sells clothing with the help of the other women in the Sabougnouma group. With her loan, she plans to buy 20 lengths of pagne [brightly colored fabric]. She resells them door-to-door and through her family, for cash or credit, to men and women customers. She procures the pagnes in Bamako and resells them in Sikasso.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 24,500 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back the loan and its interest while the other part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [brightly colored fabric]

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 30,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eden dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 38, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Engelbert who works as a driver and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a five-PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells fish, pork and vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 51,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Gina hopes to have another branch and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: 14 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE SEPTIEMBRE”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de ganado vacuno, venta de leche, panadería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de horno de panadería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, hace varios años y en la actualidad sigue trabajando en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el alimento de sus animales (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las ferias de la cuidad de  El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las tiendas aledañas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el préstamo rápido sin desconfianza. 

En la fotografía no esta una señora, ya tuvo que dirigirse a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "14 DE SEPTIEMBRE" is beginning its second loan cycle in the Pro Mujer program at the Social Center of Copacabana.  The group is comprised of nine members whose management board is led by Alicia, the president.  The different businesses carried out by the members include: clothing, cattle, milk and bread sales.

The loan being requested will benefit the group of small business owners of which Alicia is a member.  She says she has been a part of Pro Mujer for seven months and joined after a promoter from the institution visited her at home.  She currently runs a bakery which she started on her own initiative several years ago, and is still in the same business.

The loan is to buy flour at the markets in the city of El Alto which she will use to make the products she sells at stores in nearby villages.  The work gives her enough income to maintain her household.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the fact that loans are granted quickly without hesitation.

One of the members does not appear in the photograph because she had to be at work.

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Laura es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, transportista, ferretería, venta de chinelas, venta de pipocas, tejido de macramé, venta de verduras, venta de ropa de bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Laura es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de  una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que anteriormente trabajaba con ella, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de ropa) que adquirirá, por mayor, de las tiendas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "VICUÑITAS" is beginning its fourth loan cycle through the Pro Mujer program at the Social Center Los Andes.  It is comprised of eight members whose management board is led by Laura, the president.  The different businesses carried out by the group members include: a neighborhood store, transport, hardware store, sale of slippers, sale of popcorn, macramé weaving, sale of vegetables and sale of baby clothing.

The loan will benefit the group of small business owners which Laura belongs to.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years and joined after being invited by a friend who is also a member of the institution.  She currently runs a business selling underwear, which she learned from her mother when they worked together.  Later she decided to branch out on her own.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her stock (buying more clothing) which she will acquire wholesale at stores in the city of La Paz.  Afterwards, she will sell the goods at her stall.  This means of income allows her to generate enough resources to maintain her household where she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the health area.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо женщина с добрым сердцем, заботливая мать и упорный человек в достижении цели. Она замужем, имеет троих сыновей и живет с семьей в городе Вахдат. Ей 45 лет. Зебинисо имеет намерение начать собственное дело. Она умеет вышивать женские национальные платья. Это весьма прибыльное дело, так как услуги швеи  всегда в спросе. Зебинисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести компьютерную швейную машину и ткани. Она планирует в месяц вышивать по 25 обычных платьев и 20 платьев с вышивкой, в зависимости от заказа клиентов. Новый бизнес поможет Зебинисо стать независимой и улучшить качества условий жизни.
texts.en: Zabiniso is a woman with a kind heart, a caring mother and persistent in achieving her goals. She is married, has three sons and lives with her family in the town of Vahdat. She is 45 years old. Zebiniso has a goal to start her own business. She can sew traditional women's dresses. This is a profitable business because the services for sewing are always in demand. Zebiniso has come for a loan to buy an electronic sewing machine and fabrics. She plans to sew 25 regular dresses and 20 dresses with embroidery a month depending on the customer orders. This new business will help Zebiniso become independent and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine and fabric to open a new business.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yamileth del Carmen de 41 año de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega donde predomina el ron y la azúcar, el cual esta uno de los ingenios de nuestro país, es trabajadora activa del ministerio de educación la cual se desempeña como secretaria, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora con muchas responsabilidad para formar a sus hijos y brindarle un futuro mejor, Yamileth está solicitando este financiamiento para compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, cal, mano de obra, entre otros y así realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación  los cuales consiste en repello de paredes externas costado sur debido que todo se filtran y se humedece la parte interna de la casa.
texts.en:
Yamileth del Carmen, 41, is married and has two minor children.  She is from one of the towns in Chinandega where rum and sugar are the main businesses and proof of the country's talent.  Yamileth works as a secretary in the ministry of education.  She is a determined, hard-working woman who takes her responsibility seriously when educating her children for the future.

Yamileth is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, lime, etc., and to hire workers.  She wants to carry out home improvements such as covering the outside walls on the south side in order to keep out the humidity.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as sand, lime, cement,etc.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
EN LA FOTOGRAFIA APARECE DON HERINIO JUNTO A SU ESPOSA.

HERMINIO TIENE 64 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADO Y TIENE CINCO HIJOS. VIVE DESDE HACE UNOS 4 AÑOS EN LA COMUNIDAD CONSTRUYO SU CASA EN LO QUE RESULTA UNA CAPA ASFALTICA Y QUE ES PROPIEDAD DEL GOBIERNO Y QUE GOSAN DE DERECHO DE POSESION. DON HERMINIO SE CRIO COMO MUCHOS EN LA ZONA RURAL Y CON SUS PADRES APRENDIO A REALIZAR ACTIVIDADES DE PRODUCCION AGROPECUARIA TRABAJANDO COMO JORALERO Y PROPIO EN CULTIVOS DE SUB SISTENCIA, LUEGO QUE SE CASO Y SACO ADELANTE A SU FAMILA TRABAJANDO TODOS JUNTOS Y FUE  POR PROBLEMAS DE SEGRIDAD SOCIAL Y DE SALUD QUE EMIGRO DE COMUNIDAD DE ORIGEN; LUEGO SE ADACTO A LAS FORMAS DE VIDA DE LA ZONA Y LA QUIEBRA DE PIEDRAS Y LA PESCA  ARTESANAL EN LA LAGUNA EL JOCOTAL SON LAS ACTIVIDADES QUE LA MAYORIA DE LAS FAMILIAS HACEN PARA VIVIR. PERO AHORA EL SE DEDICA  A LA PRODUCCION DE GRANOS BASICOS ESPECIALMENTE MAIZ QUE VA A CULTIVAR EN UN TERRENO QUE ARRENDO EN LAS AFUERAS DE LA COMUNIDAD PARA LA EPOCA DE LLUVIAS YA QUE DONDE EL VIVE NO HAY TIERRA AGRICOLA YA QUE PRACTICAMENTE VIVEN SOBRE LA CAPA DE LAVA VOLCANICA COSOLIDADA.

EL COMPRA LOS INSUMOS PARA SU CULTIVO A UN PROVEEDOR DE LA ZONA; YA QUE POR SU EDAD Y LOS COSTOS ADICIONALES EN QUE INCURRIRIA  A EL LE SALE MEJOR COMPRARLOS EN LA COMUNIDAD, LUEGO LOS ACARREA EN LA ESPALDA CON SU ESPOSA Y UNO DE SUS HIJOS APROXIMADAMENTE TIENE QUE CARGARLOS 1.5 KILOMETROS. 


EL PRESTAMO SERA UTLIZADO PARA LA FERILIZACION DE 0.85 KILOMETROS CUADRADOS DE CULTIVO DE MAIZ Y PREPARAR EL RESTO DE TERRENO PARA SEMBRAR EN LA SEGUNDA EPOCA QUE INICIA EL 15 DE AGOSTO. DE ESTA MENERA,  NO TENDRA QUE COMPRAR EL MAIZ PARA EL CONSUMO DE SU FAMILIA A UN PRECIO QUE MUCHAS VECES LE RESULTA MUY ALTO Y POR LO ESPORADICO DE LOS TRABAJOS COMO JORNAL AVECES NO CUENTA CON DINERO PARA COMPRAR LO NECESARIO   


EN UN FUTURO DESEA TRABAJAR CON CAPITAL PROPIO Y QUIERE COMPRAR DE NUEVO UNAS DOS VACAS PARIDAS YA QUE ANTES TENIA Y LAS TUBO QUE VENDER CUANDO SE ENFERMO DE SUS RIÑONES AHORA EL GOZA DE BUENA SALUD PERO LE FALTAN RECURSOS PARA GARANIZAR LOS INGRESOS DE SU FAMILIA Y QUE SUS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS ESTUDIEN
texts.en:
Herminio is 64 years old and married. He has five children and has lived in this community for about four years. He built his house on asphalt. It is the property of the government and they enjoy right of possession. Like many others, Don Herminio grew up in the country and learnt how to do many activities pertaining to agriculture and caring for livestock by working as a day labourer and from his own experience in growing subsistence crops. He later married and he and his family got ahead by working together. It was due to social security problems and health problems that he migrated from his birthplace. He later adapted to the ways of life of his new community. Breaking stones and traditional small-scale fishing in Laguna El Jocotal are the activities the majority of families do for a living. Now he makes a living by producing staple grains, especially corn, which he is going to grow in a plot of land he has leased on the outskirts of the community for the rainy season since there is no farming land where he lives as they practically live on a layer of solidified lava.

He buys the supplies for his crops from a supplier in the area since it is better to buy them in his own community because of his age and because of the additional costs incurred if he were to buy them elsewhere. He then carries them on his back with the help of his wife and one of his children for approximately 1.5 kilometres. 

The loan will be used to fertilize 0.85 square kilometres of land ready to plant corn and he will also prepare the rest of the land for planting in the second season beginning on August 15. By doing this, he will not have to buy corn at expensive prices for his family to eat, which is good as he sometimes does not have enough money to buy what he needs due to the sporadic nature of his work as a day labourer.

In the future he wants to work with his own capital and repurchase some calved cows he had before. He had to sell them when he had kidney problems. Now he is healthy but he lacks the resources to guarantee an income for his family and paid studies for his children.

loans.use: to fertilize 0.85 square kilometres of land for his corn crops and prepare the rest of the land for planting in the second season, which starts on August 15

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло кредитуется второй цикл. Он добросовестный и честный человек. Рахматулло имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Ему 55 года. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Рахматулло родился в сельской местности и с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству. Он имеет большой опыт по скотоводству. Рахматулло более 28 лет занимается скотоводством. В основном он откармливает крупно – рогатого скота. Рахматулло ведет бизнес с помощью 2 сыновей. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке. Его бизнес является основным источником дохода семьи. Его жена медсестра и получает маленькую зарплату. Рахматулло хочет развивать бизнес дальше и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки 5 голов крупно – рогатого скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahmatullo is taking out a loan for the second cicle. He is an honest man. Rahmatullo has a good credit history. He is 55 years old, married and has four children. Rahmatullo was born in the rural area and has been helping his parents in animal husbandry since childhood. He has a great experience in animal husbandry. Rahmatullo has been in this business for 28 years. He mainly feeds large horned cattle. Rahmatulo runs his business with the help of two sons. He buys the cattle, feeds it for several months and then resells on the local market. His business is the main source of income for the family. His wife is a nurse and receives a small salary. Rahmatullo wants to grow his business further and that is why he is asking for a loan for an amount of 15,000 somoni to buy five heads of large horned cattle to increase his working capital. He is awaiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy five heads of large horned cattle to increase working capital.

loans.name: Ulmasoy

texts.ru: Улмасой добросовестная женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих не совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Он сезонно ездит в Российской Федерации и занимается строительством домов. Улмасой более 5 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры и животноводством. Улмасой всегда хотела построить новый дом для своих детей. Она несколько лет назад начала постройку дома. В этом году она планирует достроить этот дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, песок, древесина  т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ulmasoy is a conscientious woman. She is 28 years old, married and is raising three underage children. Her husband is a working migrant who is now in the Russian Federation. He goes to Russia seasonally and builds houses. Ulmasoy has been growing agriculture crops and doing animal husbandry for over five years. She has always wanted to build a new house for her children. She has started building a house several years ago. This year she plans to finish building the house. Ulmasoy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,050 USD to buy building materials such as cement, sand, wood and etc. She is awaiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials as cement, sand and wood to build a house.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a 33-year-old married woman who has three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and manages a farm, harvesting coconuts for sale to make a living.  She joined GDMPC in 2007 and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to cultivate the farm in order to increase her income to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Luminarda

texts.en: Luminarda is a 64-year-old widow and mother of three children. She lives in Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Luminarda owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to sell to earn a living. Luminarda also manages a general store, selling goods in the local community. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional goods such as rice and corn grits for sale. In the future, Luminarda wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 53 years old and married with four children. He is a farmer who lives simply in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. 

Juanito works as a farmer while his wife raises hogs and chickens. He wants his business to grow so he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 from lenders.  

Juanito wants to maintain his farming business, and this leads him to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 from lenders. He hopes that his business will continue to grow, enabling him to save money for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado, vive con su hija y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca con una cría al destete y también se encuentra preñada. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de leche para su familia y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 42, is married and has a daughter, and his family is his main priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy a pregnant dairy cow who also has a weaned calf.  The idea is to take advantage of the pasture and good climate conditions he has to raise this type of animals.  He also wants to obtain better milk for his family and raise calves to sell in the future.

With this purchase he will be able to grow his business and also have enough savings to buy more animals and more property.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSDUR.  He has never had any state bank loans and FUDECOSUR is offering him better loan tems and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mirna Jeannette

texts.es:
MIRNA TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA ACOMPAÑADA Y TIENEN TRES HIJOS DE 7, 12 Y 15 AÑOS DE EDAD RESPECTIVAMENTE. ELLA TIENE VARIOS AÑOS DE TRABAJAR DESDE QUE FORMO HOGAR HACE MAS DE 15 AÑOS Y YA CON LA LLEGADA DE LOS PRIMEROS HIJOS, LOS GASTOS EN LA CASA FUERON MAS Y EL TRABAJO COMO ALBAÑIL DE SU COMPAÑERO DE VIDA,  NO ALCANSABA PARA SATISFACER TODAS LAS NECECIDADES DE LA FAMILIA Y ELLA IDENTIFICO OPORTUNIDADES DE NEGOCIO PRIMERO CON UN MOLINO DE NIXTAMAL , LUEGO COMPRO UNA PLANCHA PARA HACER PUPUSAS Y VENDER LOS FINES DE SEMANA Y DESPUES IDENTIFICO OTRO MERCADO HACIENDO Y VENDIENO TORILLAS TODOS LOS DIAS . ELLA SE LEVANTA TODOS LOS DIAS MUY TEMPRANO A PREPARAR LA MATERIA PRIMA PARA LAS TORTILLAS POR QUE SUS CLIENTES EMPIESAN A LLEGAR  ALAS 7 A.M. Y ANTES DE ESO DEBE ALISTAR A SUS HIJOS Y LLEVARLOS A LA ESCUELA LOS MENORES CURSAN 1° Y 6° GRADO Y LA MAYOR SE DESPLASA  HASTA EL OTRO CASERIO A ESTUDIAR 9° GRADO      

 EL MAIZ QUE ES LA MATERIA PRIMA PRINCIPAL, LA ADQUIERE A LOS PRODUCORES DE LA ZONA Y LOS DEMAS INSUMOS LOS COMPRA EN LA CIUDAD, RECORRE UNOS 15 KILOMETROS A LA CIUDAD EN EL UNICO AUTOBUS QUE PASA O SI NO EN PICK UP QUE SALEN DEL CANTON A LA CIUDAD  


EL PRESTAMO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO A FUNDACION CAMPO, ES PARA COMPRAR MAIZ Y TENER INVENTARIO PARA LA EPOCA DE LLUVIAS Y COMPRARA ADEMAS ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS PARA VENDER A LOS CLIENTES DEL CASERIO COSAS DE COMESTIBLES ( CAFE, LACTEOS, ENBUTIDOS, FRIJOLES, ARROZ, AZUCAR, ETC) QUE LE PUEDEN COMPRAR CUANDO LLEGAN A TRAER LAS TORTILLAS. ADEMAS ESPERAN SEMBRAR 0.7 Ha. DE CULTIVO DE MAIZ     


CON LA INVERSIÓN  AUMENTARA Y CRECERA SU NEGOCIO YA QUE SE LE PRESENTA LA OPORTUNIDAD Y  SE   PROYECTA  A FUTURO QUE LOS GASTOS SERAN MAS YA QUE SUS HIJOS VAN AVANSANDO EN LA ESCUELA  Y LOS GASTOS SON MAS Y SU HIJA  LA MAYOR DEBERA CONTINUAR LOS ESTUDIOS DE BACHILLERATO EN LA CIUDAD Y QUIERE QUE TODOS SUS HIJOS ESTUDIEN  



EN UN FUTURO ELLA Y SU COMPAÑERO DE VIDA,  PLANEAN CONSTRUIR UNA CASA NUEVA DE LADRILLO DE OBRA O DE BLOQUE EN UN LOTE QUE LES DIO EL GOBIENO ;YA QUE ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN UNA CASA DE ADOBE REPELLADA DE CEMENTO QUE CONSTRUYERON EN UN TERRENO QUE ANTIGUAMENTE ERA LA CALLE DE UNA HACIENDA Y QUEDO ABANDONADA Y EN ESE ESPACIO VARIAS FAMILIAS DE ESCASOS RECRSOS HAN CONSTRUIDOS SUS CASAS.
texts.en:
Mirna, 31, lives with her common-law husband and three children, ages 7, 12 and 15.  She has been working from home ever since she got married over 15 years ago.  After having her first child the household expenses began to increase and the income from her husband's work as a bricklayer was not enough to cover all the family's needs.  She was initially able to see a business opportunity in running a Nixtamal mill.  Then she bought a grill to make pupusas (stuffed tortillas) which she sold on the week ends.  On the other days she was able to sell tortillas.  She gets up very early every morning to prepare what she needs to make the tortillas.  Her first customers begin arriving at 7:00 a.m. and before that she has to get the children dressed and off to school.  The youngest two are in 1st and 6th grade and the oldest goes off to another community to study 9th grade.

Corn is the main raw material for Mirna and she buys it from the producers in the area.  She buys her other supplies in the city with is 15 kilometers away so she either takes the only available bus or rides in a pick-up truck that covers the route.
  
The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy corn and have enough inventory for the rainy season.  She also will buy other products such as coffee, dairy products, sausage, beans, rice, sugar, etc. to sell to her customers when they come for the tortillas.  She also wants to plant seven acres of corn crop.

With this investment she hopes to expand and grow her business because the opportunity is there and she believes her expenses will increase as her children advance in school.  Her oldest daughter has to continue high school in the city and Mirna wants all her children to continue their education.

In the future, she and her husband want to build a new brick house on a lot they received from the government.  Now they live in an adobe house with a cement wall that they built on land that belonged to a ranch but was abandoned.  Several families with low incomes have built their houses there.

loans.use: To buy corn and food products.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад жизнерадостный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 57 лет.    Он женат и имеет одного сына.    Ахмад очень любит свою семью, и старается воспитывать своего единственного сына так, чтобы в будущем он стал хорошим человеком.    Со своей семьёй Ахмад живёт в небольшой деревне.    В свои юные годы Ахмад закончил курсы бухгалтера и по сей день работает бухгалтером в местном управлении. Но зарплаты, которую он там получает, не хватает для нормального проживания. Поэтому Ахмад решил вместе со своей женой начать свой бизнес, чтобы получать дополнительный доход. Этим бизнесом в основном занимается его жена, так как сам Ахмад весь день проводит на своей работе. Жена Ахмада занимается животноводством, она ухаживает за скотом и получает от них молоко, которое потом также продаёт. Пока у них есть в наличии 3 скота, но Ахмад хочет постепенно расширять свой бизнес, увеличивать поголовье скота, и получать от этого больше дохода. Поэтому он хочет взять кредит для покупки скота, и для получения кредита он обратился в Арванд. Ахмад надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Ahmad is a happy and positive man at the age of 57. He is married and has one son. Ahmad loves his family very much and tries to raise his only son so that he will be a good human being in the future. Ahmad lives with his family in a small village. During his young years Ahmad finished accounting courses and to this day works as an accountant in the local government. But the salary which he receives there is not enough for normal living. This is why Ahmad together with his wife decided to start own business to get additional income. This business is mainly done by his wife because Ahmad spends all day at his job. Ahmad's wife does animal husbandry, takes care of the cattle and gets the milk which then resells. At this time they have three heads of cattle, but Ahmad wants to gradually expand his business, increase the headcount of cattle and get more income from it. This is why he wants to take out a loan to buy cattle and has come for the loan to Arvand. Ahmad hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the help and support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: José Alejandro, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de almácigo de café par siembra, fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, y realizar estos trabajos a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Alejandro is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son, who are his main priority. With his loan, he intends on buying coffee seedlings for planting, fertilizer, fungicide, and to pay for the cost of labor for help with the coffee. He wants to do this work when the rains start in order to increase the plant density by area and take advantage of the good soil fertility and weather conditions that favor coffee growing. With these crop improvements, he hopes to obtain a little profit and thus improve the quality of life of his family and also invest a little in the crop and meet some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with more ease of payment and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Vilma Argentina

texts.es: Doña Vilma, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijas y vive en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Ella lleva 4 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, pastas, condimentos, sal, pan, también vende ropa, calzado, plásticos, lociones, cremas  y achinería. Esta solicitando a ODEF un segundo préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mercadería como ropa, achinería y productos de la canasta básica familiar y poder aumentar el inventario y sus ventas. Su sueño es que del negocio pueda sostener a su familia y mejorar su nivel económico.
texts.en: Vilma is 54. She is a single mother of 4 daughters and lives in the city of Victoria, Yoro. She has had her own business for 4 years. She sells food products such as rice, beans, lard, sugar, pasta, condiments, salt, and bread, as well as clothes, shoes, plastic items, lotions, creams and miscellaneous items. She is asking ODEF for a second loan, which is fo 10,000 Lempiras. It is to buy  merchandise such as clothes, miscellaneous items, and staple products to increase her inventory and her sales. Her dream is for her business to be able to support her family and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothes, miscellaneous items, and staple products to stock her store.

loans.name: Milton Odilson

texts.es: Milton, tiene 25 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Yorito, Yoro. El lleva dos años de dedicarse a su propia parcela de café, donde produce calidad de grano y lo vende en el mercado local. Su deseo de superación lo motiva a darle mantenimiento al cultivo. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, abonos y gastos de limpieza de su finca con el objetivo de sacar buena producción y calidad. Su sueño es ser un gran caficultor para mejorar su nivel económico y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Milton is 25 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives in the town of Yorito, Yoro. For two years, he has been working his own parcel of land where he grows coffee. He produces a quality bean and sells it in the local market. His wish to get ahead motivates him to maintain his crop. The loan he has asked for is for 10,000 Lempiras and will be used to buy fertilizer and to pay for clearing his farm in order to have a good, quality yield. His dream is to be a great coffee grower to improve his quality of life and help his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for clearing his farm.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
JOSE TIENE 68 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO Y TIENE DOS HIJOS Y CINCO NIETOS. ÉL CUENTA CON EXPERIENCIA DE POR VIDA YA Q DESDE QUE SUS PADRES SE TRASLADARON DESDE SU LUGAR DE ORIGEN CUANDO EL TENIA 3 AÑOS DE EDAD SU TRABAJO FUERON LAS  LABORES DE CAMPO  ALGODONERAS Y MILPAS Y TRABAJOS VARIOS EN UNA HACIENDA, SU PADRE FUE CAPORAL Y LE ENSEÑO TODO LO RELACIONADO AL MANEJO DE LOS CULTIVOS TRADICIONALES DE LA ZONA Y ESO A HECHO SIEMPRE SE CASO Y PROCREO DOS HIJOS. HOY EN DIA YA TIENE NIETOS QUIENES LE AYUDAN EN EL TRABAJO DE CAMPO Y EN EL CUIDO DE UNA TERNERA. 

PARA COMPRAR LOS  INSUMOS AGRICOLAS, SE DEBE DESPLAZAR A LA CIUDAD EN UN PICK UP A LO LARGO DE UNOS 12 KILOMETROS; LUEGO DEBE TRANSPORTAR LOS INSUMOS HASTA EL SITIO DEL CULTVO A UNOS 0.5KILOMETROS Y 1.2KILOMETROS CARGANDOLOS EN LA ESPALDA CON SU HIJO Y ALGUNOS NIETOS  


EL PRESTAMO QUE ESTA SOLIICTANDO A FUNDACIPON CAMPO, ES PARA PAGAR EL ARRIENDO DE LA TIERRA EN DONDE  CULTIVA, REPARAR LAS CERCAS Y COMPRAR TODOS LOS INSUMOS QUE REQUERIRA EL CULTIVO PARA LA SIEMBRA, MANEJO Y PRODUCCION DEL CULTIVO DE MAIZ Y SORGO. CON EL PRESTAMO, DISPONDRA  DE CAPITAL DE TRABAJO PARA PRODUCIR GRANOS QUE SON LA BASE DE LA DIETA DIARIA DE LAS FAMILIAS SALVADOREÑAS (MAIZ 1 HA ) SORGO 0.45HA  PARA LAS AVES DE PATIO Y EL RASTROJO LE SERVIRA PARA MANTENER LA TERNERA EN LA EPOCA SECA 


 SI LA TEMPORADA DE LLUVIAS ES BUENA Y CON LA BENDIDICION DE DIOS LAS COSECHAS SON BUENAS EL ESPERA COMPRAR OTRA TERNERA. LA IDEA PRINCIPAL ES ENSEÑARLES A TRABAJAR A LOS NIETOS QUE MUESTREN AMOR Y RESPETO POR LA NATURALEZA. ES CIERTO AHORA VAN A LA ESCUELA Y SEGURAMENTE SE VUELVAN PROFESIONALES PERO EL HOMBRE ES BUENO QUE SEPA GANARSE LA VIDA DE CUALQUIER FORMA SIEMPRE Y CUANDO SEA DE FORMA HONRADA Y CON EL SUDOR DE LA FRENTE.
texts.en:
José is 68 and married with two children and five grandchildren. He has amassed a lifetime of experience, starting when his parents left their home when José was three to do farm labor. José's parents worked growing cotton and corn and doing various other tasks on a ranch. His father was the foreman and taught José everything there is to know about raising the region's traditional crops, preparing him for a lifetime of farm work. Today, José's grandchildren help him work his farm and raise calves. 

José has to drive a pickup truck to the city, 12 kilometers away, to purchase agricultural supplies. He then drives back to his farm, where he, his children, and grandchildren carry everything 0.5 - 1.2 km on their backs. 

José is requesting a loan from the Campo Foundation to pay rent for the land he farms, repair fences, and purchase all of the supplies he needs for the planting, care, and harvest of corn and sorghum crops. The loan will provide working capital to produce grains that are the heart of Salvadoran families' daily diet (1 hectare corn, .45 hectare sorghum), for controlling weeds, and raising chickens and calves in the dry season.  
  
If the rainy season, with God's blessing, leads to a good harvest, José hopes to purchase more land. His main goal is to teach his grandchildren to work and to show love and respect for nature. José's grandchildren will no doubt go to school and become professionals, but a good man knows how to earn a living any honorable way he can, by the sweat of his brow.

loans.use: To pay rent for the land he farms, repair fences, an purchase all of the supplies he needs for the planting, care, and harvest of corn and sorghum crops. The loan will provide working capital to produce grains that are the base of Salvadoran families' daily diet (1 hectare corn, .45 hectare sorghum), for controlling weeds, and raising chickens and calves in the dry season.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en: Afshan, 36, lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband provides decoration lights for weddings and other occasions. He wants to purchase electric wires, cables, bulb holders and bulbs. However, due to inadequate savings, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Afshan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the things necessary for his business. This will help him to continue his business. Afshan is extremely thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase electric wires, cables, bulb holders and bulbs.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a 31-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse, three sons, and two daughters. Since 2008, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the market. Naila has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With this loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more variety to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man who is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Sakeena's Group

texts.en:
Sakeena, 29, is a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and two children. Her husband has been running a gemstone business for 10 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Sakeena has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.

With this loan, her husband wants to purchase new varieities of rare gemstones. This will attract more customers and his sales will increase. After getting the profit, Sakeena will pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children. As a member of a two-person group, Sakeena is very happy with this loan. She is raising her hand in the picture

loans.use: to purchase rare gems.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: A responsible mother of six children, Perveen is 53 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan where she is married to a rickshaw driver whose rickshaw needs repair. Perveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairs so he can resume earning money. Perveen is so very thankful to Kiva for this assistance.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en:
Sardar is a 59-year-old woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and daughter. 

She has been doing the business of selling school bags for 26 years. Her sales are increasing with time. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would purchase a new variety of school bags so that her sales and net income will be increased. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC

loans.use: To purchase a new variety of school bags.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 35-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. 

She belongs to a very poor family. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. 

Currently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Mariam, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to purchase a refrigerator for preserving food. Mariam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the field.

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 53 años es conviviente con un hijo aun  educando. En el grupo “LAS GARDENIAS” cumple la función de secretaria. El cual está conformado por  06 socios  trabajadores quienes se encuentran pasando al 11 ciclo. Elizabeth hace 15 años vende comida en forma ambulatoria, en sus tiempos libres brinda servicios de lavado de ropa. Es de esta manera como apoya a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. Hace dos años compro un carro con el cual trabaja su esposo. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva cocina y ollas para poder seguir ofreciendo su rica comida a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es tener un negocio de jugueria en su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Elizabeth es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and lives with her son who is still in school. She is secretary to the group "LAS GARDENIAS", which is made up of 6 hard working borrowers who have already been through 11 loan cycles.

Elizabeth has worked as a street trader selling food for 15 years. In her spare time she provides laundry services. This is how she helps her husband with the household costs. Two years ago she bought a car which her husband uses for work. 

Her loan will be invested in buying a new stove and cooking pots in order to continue preparing her delicious food for clients. Her greatest wish is to run a juicing business from her home. The group thanks KIVA lenders for the loan provided. Elizabeth is first on the right in the picture.

loans.use: Para comprar una cocina y renovar sus ollas en mal estado

loans.name: Kotognogontala  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’Tjila, un des villages de Niena dans la commune rurale de Wateni, région SIKASSO, 3ème  ville administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec Safiatou                                      débout en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village. Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 95.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the group "Kotognogontala 4" are married women averaging 45 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in N’Tjila, a Niena village, in Commune Rurale de Wateni, in Région SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown are peanuts and corn, as is the case with Safiatou, who is standing first from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, herbicides, and seeds and to pay for plowing for maintaining 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses and the cost of the children's healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 41 years old and a mother of four. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. Together with her husband, they aim to uplift their status of living and continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. For this reason, Myrna engaged in a hog-raising business to earn additional income. She wishes to improve the business and make it profitable, but she has limited capital. 

Therefore, she is asking for an additional 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise, feeds, vitamins and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will further improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 15 years now together with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Antonia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Antonia hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. 

Tessie runs a retail store at home. She has been in business for years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from store operations. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy additional inventory. She joined the GDMPC in 2011. 

In the future, Tessie hopes to obtain a good return from this investment and acquire enough revolving funds for the business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a 23-year-old married woman with one child who lives in Seti, Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a farm where she plants vegetables and papaya for sale. She's been doing this for three years. 

She borrowed a loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which she joined recently, to buy fertilizer such as manure.

She plans to plant another variety of seedlings to expand her garden in order to generate additional income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental is a married woman with one child. She is used to managing her fishing business catching and selling fish for sale. She became a member of GDMPC microcredit in 2011 and she's now requesting an amount of 8,000 PHP to purchase a fishing net.

She plans to buy another fishing boat in order to have an additional income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Thelma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase kitchenwares and ingredients for her food production business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenwares and ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eleven years.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is widow and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Susana is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is borrowing a new loan to buy groceries for her general store. This is her 16th loan from NWTF. The purified drinking water business, that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, provides her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, dried fish, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Aseela Group

texts.en:
This is a group with initiative, values, and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called "Aseela" and consists of four women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They are each interested in developing their business. They requested a loan of 180,000 YER. 

Aseela is the group leader. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her business is embroidery, ladies' clothes, bags, and children's clothes. This has been her sole source of income for over five years. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothes market in her neighborhood. With the income from her business she can improve her home and enjoy more comfort. 

At the present time, her business doesn't get her enough profits due to the bad situation in Yemen. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles for embroidery, such as needles and thread, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her business income. In the future, she would like to expand her business to open manual labor stores.

loans.use: to acquire articles for embroidery, such as needles and thread, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her business income.

loans.name: Les Chérubins Group

texts.fr: La cliente Fatuma est trésorière  du groupe de crédit « Les chérubins », doyenne du groupe,  entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 ayant leurs propres foyers et 2 étudiants. La cliente est vendeuse des œufs.  Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de ses enfants. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 plaquettes d’œufs. Les maladies de volailles (grippe aviaire et autres), les cassures sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler qu'un enfant d'une cliente s'est infiltré sur la photo du groupe.
texts.en:
This client, Fatuma, is the treasurer of the loan group "Les chérubins". The most senior member of the group, she is a brave entrepreneur, 51 years old, a widow, and a mother of six children, of whom four have their own homes, and two are students. She started this business with funds from her children. This new loan will be used to purchase 20 trays of eggs. Poultry diseases (avian flu and others) and vandals are some of the major obstacles in developing her business. 

For the future, she would like to expand her enterprise and provide schooling to her children. So, she thanks Hekima for its micro-credit support of women entrepreneurs. It should be noted that a child of one of the clients has slipped into the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Carine Félicité

texts.fr: carine est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère un mini restaurant dans un quartier de la ville où elle fait des repas camerounais depuis 1 an. elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de matières premières afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son profit. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter son capital d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Carine is a 33-year-old woman, unmarried, and a mother of one child. She owns and manages a mini-restaurant in a district in the city where she has been making Cameroonian dishes for a year. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of supplies in order to grow her sales and her profits. The profits generated will enable her to increase her capital on the one hand and to meet family needs on the other.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of food for her mini-restaurant

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina, age 54, is a very hardworking housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a butcher shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Zarina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will use the loan amount for purchasing a knife-sharpening machine. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to save money so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Zarina, hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a knife-sharpening machine for her husband's butcher shop.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, age 45, is a hardworking housewife. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a milk seller by profession, which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to grow his business as currently his monthly net income is inadequate to meet the household's needs. 

Rehana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase a buffalo to sell its milk. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Rehana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo to sell its milk

loans.name: Zohran

texts.en:
Zohran is a 43-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and two daughters. 

Her husband has been running a tire shop for two years. Zohran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase new tires for selling and this would increase his net income and savings. Zohran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new tires.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, age 51, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband stitches bags and sells them in the main market. She helps her husband in his business as well. 

Parveen, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase a sewing machine for stitching bags. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture Parveen is wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for stitching bags.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe Kotognogontala 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’Tjila, un des villages de Niena dans la commune rurale de Wateni, région SIKASSO, 3ème  ville administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide et le maïs avec Nassira                                      débout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village. Après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogontala 5 group are married women, who, on average, are 45 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in N'Tjila, one of the villages of Niena in the rural commune of Wateni, Sikasso, the third administrative region in Mali. They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming during the rainy season.

The group is on their fifth loan with the institution, and all of their previous loans have been repaid.

Nassira, standing in the middle of the photo, grows ground nuts and corn. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds and also pay the cost of labor to maintain one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, she will sell her crops in the village to men and women customers. She hopes to earn 105,000 francs CFA per field. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses and support her children's health costs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita and her husband dream of improving their way of living for their family, and to send their children to school.  She is 48 years old, and blessed with four children. 

She is engaged in the hog raising business, and helps her husband generate income for their family.  Due to high cost of school fees, she needs to earn a higher income to meet the educational needs of their children.  

Perlita plans to borrow additional capital for the maintenance of her business.  She needs to borrow P15 000 to buy additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines. 

She believes that her loan will be granted to improve the business and make it profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works as a farmer. Farming is the business that Editha and her family relies on for a living and corn is their main crop. Their income is just enough for their meals, bills at home, and revolving capital for the business.  

Editha wants her business to grow and she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000.  She will use this to buy insecticides and fertilizer for the maintenance of their crops.  

Editha hopes to have a good harvest and to have a progressive life for her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizer used in farming.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 32 years old. A mother from Migori county, she is married to Benard who is employed and offers financial support to the family. She supports five people in her family and has been blessed with four children age 10, eight, six, and four years old.

She sells second-hand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last five years, and makes a monthly income of KES. 30,000. She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase second-hand clothes for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to expand her business and be in a position to generate enough income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He runs a butchery business which he started 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000.
